title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 126.1 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 126.1 - General

State Regulations

Each part-time judge or justice of a city, town or village court who is temporarily assigned to a city court pursuant to
section
107
of
the Uniform City Court Act, shall receive $250 per day, or such lesser amount
as his or her order of assignment may specify, for each day or part thereof
during which such judge or justice actually performs judicial duties in
accordance with such assignment in a courtroom or other facility designated for
court appearances, provided that a judge or justice who performs such judicial
duties for one half day or less shall receive $125 per day. There shall be no
compensation for out-of-court work performed by any such judge or justice while
on temporary assignment. Such judge or justice shall be reimbursed for
out-of-pocket expenses reasonably and necessarily incurred in the performance
of his or her duties while on temporary assignment in accordance with the
provisions of Part 102 of this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
126.1

Amended

New

York State Register October 25, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 43, eff. 10/1/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
